sense.name: Come into possession (by purchase or hearing), capture, receive, obtain
sense.examples: Get permission to take a few days off from work. I got nothing but trouble for my good intentions. Get me those books over there, please. Get an idea for a birthday party theme. The Brazilian team got four goals. We finally got the suspect. "How to get the attention of unruly school children." You cannot get water out of a stone. What did you get at the toy store? She didn't get his name when they first met. Why should the president get hell for initiating a war? He got five years in prison. What do you get when you add these numbers? She got the bus just as it was leaving. Almost all batters strike out more than they get a base on balls.

sense.name: Catch, come down with
sense.examples: I got funny spots all over my body. She got a cold from John.

sense.name: Become
sense.commentary: For this sense, the subject is undergiong a change; there is no cause mentioned. Syntax is: NP[patient] GET ADJP[result]
sense.examples: It must be getting more serious. I'm getting mad.

sense.name: cause to be/do
sense.commentary: For this sense, the subject is a cause of a change, not the undergoer. Syntax is: NP[Agent] V NP[Patient] ADJP[Result] NP[Agent] V NP[Patient] S[Result] NP[Agent] V NP[Patient] PP[Result]
sense.examples: He got his squad on the ball. The children finally got me to buy a computer. You don't wanna get me mad. His lying really gets me. Brahms' "Requiem" gets me every time. "Got me! I don't know the answer." She got the mood just right in her photographs.

sense.name: enter a state
sense.commentary: For this sense, the subject is the undergoer and the final state must be realised with a "to" preposition. Syntax is: NP[Patient] V to-PP[Result]
sense.examples: He got to believing in serpent worship.

sense.name: Arrive at, reach a person or place
sense.examples: She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight. "Get!" "Get outta here!" he shouted.

sense.name: Get revenge, overcome, destroy
sense.examples: We'll get them for this! This time I got him! The cat got my goldfish. The ice storm got my flowers.

sense.name: Communicate with person or place
sense.examples: Bill called this number and he got Mary. The operator couldn't get Kobe because of the earthquake. He never got hold of his children while he was in Australia. She finally got through to him over the phone. Did you finally get in touch with your long-lost cousin?

sense.name: Light verb usage - undergo
sense.commentary: Tag all usages where "get" isn't the main predicate--it accompanies a NOUN that expresses the event semantis. The only semantics to "get" are likely to be those that indicate that the subject is an undergoer of the main event.
sense.examples: He got an insulin shock after eating too much candy. The other fighter got a punch to the face. I just got surgery last week.

sense.name: Auxiliary usage--start, able to
sense.commentary: Tag all usages where "get" isn't the main predicate--it accompanies VERB that expresses the event semantics. The only semantics to "get" are likely to be those that indicate that the main event is starting, or with certain infinitives, that the subject has the privilege of doing the main event.
sense.examples: Get working as soon as the sun rises. Get going! You have to mail in a couple of forms before you get to vote. I get to go home in one week!

sense.name: VPC/multiword expression
sense.commentary: NOTE: Due to the incredible number of vpc/mwe entries, example sentences will not be given, but the phrases will simply be listed. Many of these overlap with the above senses. That's okay.
sense.examples: get_a_line get_a_load get_a_look get_a_noseful get_a_whiff get_about get_across get_ahead get_along get_along_with get_around get_around_to get_at get_away get_back get_back_at get_behind get_by get_cracking get_down get_dressed get_even get_hitched_with get_hold get_hold_of get_in get_into get_it get_it_on get_laid get_married get_moving get_off get_off_the_ground get_on get_on_with get_one's_lumps get_onto get_out get_over get_rid_of get_rolling get_started get_stuck get_the_best get_the_better_of get_the_goods get_the_hang get_the_jump get_the_picture get_through get_to get_to_grips get_together get_under_one's_skin get_up get_weaving get_well get_wind get_wise get_word get_worse
